page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: People have lived in Holmes Chapel for hundreds of years but most of the houses seen today belong to this century. We have a Queen Anne mansion called "The Hermitage", a timber framed thatched cottage and several Georgian farmhouses, e.g. "The Orchards" but most of the older houses are found in the village centre. These date from the 18th century and many have been converted into shops. There are few Victorian houses and so the next development seems to be inter_war semis which follow the main roads. Post war estates complete the infill of land bounded by the railway and the main roads. The houses are mainly semi_detached and detached. Most recent development has taken place between the village centre and the motorway radically changing the village.
